name: MDCG 2022-21 Annex III - Presentation and Assessment of Collected Data
description: Rules for presenting and assessing PMS data in the PSUR as mandated by MDCG 2022-21

dataset_separation.rule: Each dataset must be analyzed individually before cross-dataset analysis
dataset_separation.description: Complaints, incidents, literature, registry data, etc. must first be presented separately
dataset_separation.validation_prompt: Verify that each data source (complaints, incidents, PMCF, literature, registries) is presented in its own section before any combined analysis.

device_granularity.rule: Data should be presented at the Basic UDI-DI level where possible, with aggregation at device model/family level justified
device_granularity.validation_prompt: Check if data is presented at the Basic UDI-DI level. If aggregated, verify justification for grouping devices.

regional_split.rule: Data must be split by EEA+TR+XI and Worldwide as a minimum
regional_split.validation_prompt: Verify that all quantitative data is split between EEA+TR+XI and Worldwide regions.

terminology_requirements.validation_prompt: Verify that IMDRF Level 2 codes are used for all incident categorization. Check that Annexes A, C, D, and F codes are correctly applied.

cross_dataset_analysis.description: Analysis must look across all data sources to identify patterns and correlations
analysis_types: Correlation between complaint themes and incident types
Literature findings vs. real-world experience comparison
Registry data benchmarking against own device data
PMCF results correlation with safety data
cross_dataset_analysis.validation_prompt: Check if the PSUR includes cross-dataset analysis comparing findings across complaints, incidents, literature, registries, and PMCF data.

population_specific_evaluation.description: Analysis must consider specific patient/user populations if data suggests differential outcomes
population_specific_evaluation.validation_prompt: Verify if population subgroup analysis is performed where data suggests differential outcomes across patient populations.

state_of_art_comparison.description: Device safety and performance must be compared against current state of the art
state_of_art_comparison.validation_prompt: Check if the PSUR includes comparison of device performance against state-of-the-art standards and similar devices.

risk_threshold_analysis.description: Analysis must identify when incident rates exceed predefined risk thresholds
risk_threshold_analysis.validation_prompt: Verify that the PSUR includes analysis against predefined risk thresholds and identifies any threshold exceedances.

emerging_signal_detection.description: The PSUR must include systematic signal detection methodology
emerging_signal_detection.validation_prompt: Check if systematic signal detection methods are applied and documented, including trend analysis and disproportionality assessment.

combination_device_analysis.description: For combination products, interactions between device and drug/biological must be analyzed
combination_device_analysis.validation_prompt: For combination products, verify that device-medicinal component interactions are analyzed.

comparative_device_analysis.description: If similar devices exist, comparative safety analysis should be included
comparative_device_analysis.validation_prompt: Check if comparative analysis against similar devices is performed using registries, literature, or regulatory databases.

data_quality_assessment.validation_prompt: Verify that data quality is assessed and limitations are explicitly discussed.

methodology_statement.validation_prompt: Check that methodology is explicitly stated including data sources, criteria, and statistical approaches.

benefit_risk_statement.validation_prompt: Verify that a clear benefit-risk conclusion is stated with supporting rationale.

action_items.validation_prompt: Check that required actions (CAPAs, FSCAs, document updates) are clearly identified with timelines.

llm_assessment_prompts.overall_presentation_quality: Evaluate if the PSUR data presentation follows MDCG 2022-21 Annex III requirements for dataset separation, regional splits, temporal comparisons, and IMDRF terminology usage.
llm_assessment_prompts.assessment_completeness: Verify that the PSUR includes all required assessment elements: cross-dataset analysis, population evaluation, state-of-art comparison, risk thresholds, and signal detection.
llm_assessment_prompts.conclusion_adequacy: Assess if the conclusions are adequately supported by the presented data and analysis, with clear benefit-risk determination and action items.
llm_assessment_prompts.methodology_transparency: Check if the methodology is sufficiently transparent to allow reproducibility and audit.
llm_assessment_prompts.regulatory_compliance_score: Provide an overall MDCG 2022-21 Annex III compliance score (0-100) with specific gaps identified.

validation_checklist.requirement: Dataset separation - each data source presented individually
Basic UDI-DI level data or justified aggregation
Temporal comparison with appropriate time buckets
